ai-patthana18.24:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma, third in the place he had allowed to,
ai-patthana18.24:1.1_0: For this is because of not seeing the cause, for the sake of seeing, not to be given up. These are the three conditions for the sake of seeing.
ai-patthana18.24:2.1_0: because of not seeing only they should be given up without seeing, because of not seeing, there is no cause or condition.
ai-patthana18.24:2.1_3: What four trivial trees have been uneven.
ai-patthana18.24:3.1_0: without seeing the cause, not to be given up. ...
ai-patthana18.24:4.1_0: without seeing the cause, one is to be given up.
ai-patthana18.24:4.1_3: What is not the reason for two reasons.
ai-patthana18.24:5.1_0: For the sake of developing the teaching you shouldn’t give up the cause, for the sake of developing the path, or for the sake of developing the mind.
ai-patthana18.24:5.1_1: The cause should not be given up again and again to give up that state.
ai-patthana18.24:5.1_4: What four trivial trees have been uneven.
ai-patthana18.24:6.1_0: you should not give up any cause or reason for developing the teaching, or for the sake of developing the teaching.
ai-patthana18.24:7.1_0: (They are) not given up. Developing the teaching should be given up. Not developing any cause or reason for the sake of development.
ai-patthana18.24:7.1_3: What is not the reason for two reasons.
ai-patthana18.24:9.1_0: without seeing the cause, for the sake of not recognizing, for the sake of not recognizing, nor for the sake of showing the reason.
ai-patthana18.24:10.1_0: without seeing the cause, without reason, they don’t give up the cause, with without reason, because of seeing the cause,
ai-patthana18.24:10.1_1: without seeing the cause, without reason, because of not seeing the reason and no cause or condition.
ai-patthana18.24:10.1_4: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
